intro: Lepigonum caninum, commonly known as dog's mercury, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features slender, upright stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom in early spring. Lepigonum caninum is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia.
